title: Serifs like Egyptian 505
content:
So what are some fonts with serifs like in Egyptian 505?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/egyptian+505/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140710231139/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/egyptian+505/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/egyptian+505/fonts/")

I guess I'd call them adnate slab.

hhp
author: hrant

comments.content: So like a Clarendon, then? Or am I missing something?

I'd like to make a list, and Clarendons would fit, although maybe thicker on the serifs.

hhp
The way I see it, the ‘adnate slab-serifs’ like Egyptienne F, Egyptian 505, and the like, are related to the Transitionals, whereas Ionics, Clarendons, and such, are linked to the Moderns.

Aren't these bracketed slab serifs? [http://martinsilvertant.deviantart.com/art/Serif-types-375667428](http://web.archive.org/web/20140710231139/http:/martinsilvertant.deviantart.com/art/Serif-types-375667428 "http://martinsilvertant.deviantart.com/art/Serif-types-375667428")

Are you looking for faces like Bree Serif, Eames Century Modern and Regan Slab?
